extendedIngredients.name: clarified butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: Olive oil or clarified butter for coating pan

extendedIngredients.name: gluten-free bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cup bread crumbs (since I cook gluten-free, I made my bread crumbs by pulsing an Udi's bagel in the food processor)
metaInformation: (since I cook , I made my bread crumbs by pulsing an Udi's bagel in the food processor)

extendedIngredients.name: quinoa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/2 cups cooked white quinoa, at room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: raw cashews
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups raw cashews, soaked in water for 30 minutes and drained

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 roasted red bell pepper, seeds and skinless (from a jar is fine)

recipes.title: Crispy Quinoa Cakes with Roasted Red Pepper Cashew Cream

winePairing.pairingText: Cake works really well with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a large bowl combine the quinoa, eggs, and salt; stir to mix well. Add the basil, red onion, cheese, garlic, and breadcrumbs to the bowl; stir, then let the mixture sit for a few minutes so that the bread crumbs can absorb some of the moisture. If your mixture is too wet you can add a little more breadcrumbs at this point and if it is too dry add a small amount of water.Heat a tablespoon of olive oil or clarified butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium-low heat. Form the mixture into 12 small patties; when the oil is hot place enough patties in the skillet so that it is full, but the patties still have room in between them. Cover, and cook for 7-10 minutes, until the bottoms are crisp and deeply browned. Carefully flip the patties with a spatula and cook the second side for about 7 minutes more. Remove from the skillet and cool on a wire rack while you cook the remaining patties. Add all of the ingredients in a high powered blender or food processor and blend on high, stopping to scrape down the sides if necessary. Blend until the cashew cream is smooth and silky with no chunks. Taste and adjust seasonings to your liking.

steps.step: In a large bowl combine the quinoa, eggs, and salt; stir to mix well.

Add the basil, red onion, cheese, garlic, and breadcrumbs to the bowl; stir, then let the mixture sit for a few minutes so that the bread crumbs can absorb some of the moisture. If your mixture is too wet you can add a little more breadcrumbs at this point and if it is too dry add a small amount of water.

Heat a tablespoon of olive oil or clarified butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium-low heat. Form the mixture into 12 small patties; when the oil is hot place enough patties in the skillet so that it is full, but the patties still have room in between them. Cover, and cook for 7-10 minutes, until the bottoms are crisp and deeply browned. Carefully flip the patties with a spatula and cook the second side for about 7 minutes more.
Remove from the skillet and cool on a wire rack while you cook the remaining patties.

Add all of the ingredients in a high powered blender or food processor and blend on high, stopping to scrape down the sides if necessary. Blend until the cashew cream is smooth and silky with no chunks. Taste and adjust seasonings to your liking.
